movements.name: Back Squat
movements.description: A compound lower body movement where the barbell is placed on the upper back and the athlete performs a squat

scalingOptions.name: Box Squat
scalingOptions.description: Squat to a box to reduce range of motion

scalingOptions.name: Goblet Squat
scalingOptions.description: Hold kettlebell at chest to learn proper form

techniqueCues: Push knees out in line with toes
movements.frequencyGuidelines: 2-3 times per week with 48 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Deadlift
movements.description: A compound hip hinge movement where the barbell is lifted from the floor to a standing position

scalingOptions.name: Romanian Deadlift
scalingOptions.description: Start from standing position, focus on hip hinge

movements.frequencyGuidelines: 1-2 times per week with 48-72 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Burpees
movements.description: A full body movement combining a squat, push-up, and jump

scalingOptions.name: Step Back Burpee
scalingOptions.description: Step back instead of jumping back

scalingOptions.name: Burpee Box Jump Over
scalingOptions.description: Add box jump over at the end

movements.frequencyGuidelines: 2-3 times per week with 24 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Clean
movements.description: An Olympic lift where the barbell is pulled from the floor to the front rack position in one fluid motion
movements.frequencyGuidelines: 2-3 times per week with 48 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Pull-up
movements.description: A bodyweight exercise where the athlete pulls their body up to a bar until their chin is over the bar
movements.frequencyGuidelines: 2-3 times per week with 24 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Wall Balls
movements.description: A combination of a squat and overhead throw using a medicine ball
movements.frequencyGuidelines: 2-3 times per week with 24 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Kettlebell Swing
movements.description: A hip hinge movement where the kettlebell is swung between the legs and up to chest height

scalingOptions.name: Single Arm Swing
scalingOptions.description: Use one arm at a time

movements.frequencyGuidelines: 2-3 times per week with 24 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Snatch
movements.description: An Olympic lift where the barbell is pulled from the floor to overhead in one fluid motion
movements.frequencyGuidelines: 2-3 times per week with 48 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Push-up
movements.description: A bodyweight exercise where the athlete lowers and raises their body using their arms while maintaining a plank position

scalingOptions.name: Knee Push-up
scalingOptions.description: Perform from knees instead of toes

scalingOptions.name: Incline Push-up
scalingOptions.description: Hands elevated on box or bench

movements.frequencyGuidelines: 3-4 times per week with 24 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Box Jump
movements.description: A plyometric movement where the athlete jumps onto an elevated box and lands softly

scalingOptions.name: Box Jump Over
scalingOptions.description: Jump over box instead of landing on it

movements.frequencyGuidelines: 2-3 times per week with 24 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Double Unders
movements.description: A jump rope movement where the rope passes under the feet twice per jump
movements.frequencyGuidelines: 3-4 times per week with 24 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Bench Press
movements.description: A compound upper body movement where the athlete presses a barbell from chest level to full arm extension
movements.frequencyGuidelines: 1-2 times per week with 48 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Jerk
movements.description: An Olympic lift where the barbell is driven from the front rack position to overhead using a split or push jerk technique
movements.frequencyGuidelines: 2-3 times per week with 48 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Handstand Push-up
movements.description: A bodyweight exercise where the athlete performs a push-up while in a handstand position against a wall
movements.frequencyGuidelines: 2-3 times per week with 48 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Row
movements.description: A cardio movement using a rowing machine to simulate the motion of rowing a boat
movements.frequencyGuidelines: 3-4 times per week with 24 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Front Squat
movements.description: A compound lower body movement where the barbell is held in the front rack position while performing a squat
movements.frequencyGuidelines: 2-3 times per week with 48 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Dips
movements.description: A bodyweight exercise where the athlete lowers and raises their body using parallel bars or rings

scalingOptions.name: Box Dips
scalingOptions.description: Use box or bench for support

movements.frequencyGuidelines: 2-3 times per week with 48 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Run
movements.description: A cardio movement where the athlete moves at a faster pace than walking
movements.frequencyGuidelines: 3-4 times per week with 24 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Overhead Press
movements.description: A compound upper body movement where the barbell is pressed from shoulder level to overhead

scalingOptions.name: Push Press
scalingOptions.description: Use leg drive to assist the press

movements.frequencyGuidelines: 2-3 times per week with 48 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Abmat Sit-up
movements.description: A core exercise using an abmat to support the lower back while performing sit-ups
movements.frequencyGuidelines: 3-4 times per week with 24 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Power Clean
movements.description: An Olympic lift variation where the barbell is pulled from the floor to the front rack position, catching in a quarter squat
movements.frequencyGuidelines: 2-3 times per week with 48 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Ring Rows
movements.description: A bodyweight exercise where the athlete pulls their body up using gymnastics rings while maintaining a horizontal position

scalingOptions.name: Feet Elevated
scalingOptions.description: Place feet on box for increased difficulty

scalingOptions.name: Single Arm Row
scalingOptions.description: Perform one arm at a time

movements.frequencyGuidelines: 2-3 times per week with 24 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Assault Bike
movements.description: A cardio machine that combines air resistance with arm and leg movement
commonFaults: Not using full range of motion
movements.frequencyGuidelines: 3-4 times per week with 24 hours rest between sessions

movements.name: Romanian Deadlift
movements.description: A hip hinge movement where the barbell is lowered with a focus on hamstring and glute engagement

scalingOptions.name: Single Leg RDL
scalingOptions.description: Perform one leg at a time

movements.frequencyGuidelines: 2-3 times per week with 48 hours rest between sessions
